metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2827 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in Google Chrome before 13.0.782.215 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via vectors related to text searching.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 13.0.782.215~r97094-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 13.0.782.215~r97094-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 13.0.782.215~r97094-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 13.0.782.215~r97094-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 13.0.782.215~r97094-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '13.0.782.215~r97094-0ubuntu1').
